channel.title: OK, storytime :)
channel.description:
OK, today, at school, I got pulled out of lesson 3 to go to the headteacher. I sat there wondering what I'd done, nervous as fuck, finally after about 20 minutes, I was called in, as she was on the phone previously, I sat down and waited for her to say something. She brought up an email from the school I.T technicians on her computer, turned round and looked at me and started explaining. She said I had been using unlicensed adobe products on the school system, and I could be facing fines of up to £500,000, if the police were contacted.
All it was, was a portable version of Photoshop CS4, which I was using for design work for my website and the I.C.T Portfolio and full course project. Currently, I'm scared shitless, lets just say I have a lot of stuff on my laptop. ;) And I would much prefer that it was not found. And the ironic thing is, I was actually using the trial version, yes, I downloaded it illegally, but I never actually used the crack on it. However, there was a text file within the folder titled 'serial', so I don't think it'd be a good idea to explain to them it was just a trial downloaded from the Adobe website.
I am now banned altogether from using the school computers for the rest of this year, which is the rest of my secondary school life.
£500,000, do you think she was being serious? How likely is it that I'm well, fucked?

Damn. My school sucks. ;(

And for the story, no further action has been taken, as of yet, fortunately.

item.title: OK, storytime :)
item.dc:creator: @Javafire Javafire
item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:39, topic:339742”][quote author=Javafire link=topic=436118.msg3204174#msg3204174 date=1273623204]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=436118.msg3204168#msg3204168 date=1273623096]

Our schools computer system sucks. You are monitored with everything you do because they used a paid-for program called SynchronEyes. It basically brings up a screen of the computer network and what everyone is doing on them. I visited GameFAQs during a computer lit class once, and was basically told I am kicked off for a month+ if I post on it.
[/quote]Same thing at my school, just a different program.
[/quote] Kill the damn principal

Actually he pretty much just goes with whatever the computer teachers go with. The only thing I can blame HIM for is taking away open campus during finals. Tell me if this makes sense?

Scene: Winter, 2009. First finals of the year. Roads are icy.
Open-campus for those who don’t have it: Students may leave the school campus when they are not taking a final. I had up to 5 hours with no finals on one of the days.

So basically for no apparent reason our principal decides to remove open-campus for freshmen and sophomores, but have it remain for juniors and seniors. His excuse was, “it’s a safety issue”. Yes because may slip on the ice and crack our necks going to subway while the teenage drivers are perfectly safe.[/quote] Damn that is so fucked up dude :P. Oh and i agree with your sig, rip teh rev

Read full topic

item.title: OK, storytime :)
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Yes, she was being serious. I torrented some 60$ tutorial from a site i do not want to say, and inside was an FBI backup for a fine of $250,000 for copying or redistributing.

IMO they won’t fine a kid in court. If you’re trying to learn something on the computer and it requires you to purchase a $1000+ program most likely your parents will lol and say go outside. If you explain you weren’t selling any of your creations and it was strictly for learning yourself you’d probably get some kinda penalty or community service and not a fine. And if you endup going to court explain that you wouldn’t do such a thing in the professional world and you would buy it when you had your own money to do so.

PS: my school memory stick has $4000 worth of stuff on it.

Read full topic

item.title: OK, storytime :)
item.dc:creator: @Tribbinator Tribbinator
item.description:
@Tribbinator wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:16, topic:339742”][quote author=Tribbinator link=topic=436118.msg3203821#msg3203821 date=1273604073]
That is pretty awesome, turning arguments in your favor is the greatest. To be able to delete the serial file…

~Steps~
1.) Contact a good friend of yours
2.) Record step-by-step instructions to delete the ‘serial’ file
3.) Make mp3
4.) Give said mp3 file to the good friend from step 1 and have him ‘listen to music’ while doing ‘schoolwork’

That should work…but i dont know how your school works, so it probably wont work at all
[/quote]

We don’t have access to other user’s personal folders. I did decrypt one of the admin’s passwords before but it was changed… :o good try.[/quote]

Dangit. Well I tried…be sure to update me on this!

Read full topic
